text: And I was trying to pronounce it.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And when you're trying to pronounce it, your mouth gets tense.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And actually, you need a very relaxed mouth to pronounce this R because you're kind of lifting your tongue up a little bit and letting the air flap it.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: Now, that's a muscle.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: If it's tense, the air can't flap it.

text: So I tried a very long time.

text: And the R came out all by itself.

text: And then I heard the gringo is hungry.

text: The more you hear, just because you want to pronounce it, it's going to come.

text: So initial R or two R's together inside the word is going to pronounce this double R.
